paragraphs: Residents and guests of Prague will have a unique opportunity on Sunday, September 28th to visit the luxurious Nostitz Palace (Nostick√Ω pal√°c), which houses the Ministry of Culture of the Czech Republic. The ministry invites all interested parties to an "Open Day".
As part of the free tours, guests will see stunning ceremonial halls used for hosting foreign delegations, award ceremonies, and other official events.

Visitors will also be shown the office of the Minister of Culture, a gallery with many works by famous Czech artists, a library, the Chapel of the Assumption of the Virgin Mary, and other rooms of the palace.
Admission to the event is free. Excursions will take place in organized groups with a guide. The duration of the tour program will be about 20 minutes.
üïò When: September 28, 2025, from 09:00 to 17:00 (the last tour will start at 16:30).
